title: Freeform game name + required prompt field in mod creation and mod metadata displays

requirements.summary: Replace the game selector and Create New Game dialog in the mod creation wizard with a single required freeform game name text input.
acceptanceCriteria: In the wizard step currently labeled “Game”, the UI shows a text input (not a dropdown/select) for entering the game name.
The “Create New Game” dialog and any dependency on listing/creating games in this wizard step are removed from the UI.
The Next button remains disabled until a non-empty game name is provided.
All user-facing text remains in English.

file_operations.description: Replace the Select-based game picker and the Create New Game dialog with a required freeform Input for game name; remove state and logic tied to selectedGameId/new game creation and remove wizard dependencies on useListGames/useCreateGame; update wizard copy to English text appropriate for entering a game name.

requirements.summary: Add a required Prompt field to the mod details step and include it in the publish/createMod call payload.
acceptanceCriteria: The mod details UI includes a clearly labeled Prompt field (required) with validation feedback consistent with existing fields.
Publishing a mod includes the prompt value in the createMod call from the frontend to the backend.
Backend stores the prompt on the mod record and returns it in mod queries (creator view and unlisted/public view).
If prompt is missing/empty when creating a mod, the backend rejects the request with a clear error message.

file_operations.description: Add wizard state for prompt; pass prompt into the details step UI; ensure publishing passes prompt and freeform gameName into useCreateMod.mutateAsync in addition to existing required fields.
Extend the ModEditorForm to render a required Prompt field (clearly labeled in English) with validation feedback styling/patterns consistent with existing Title/Version/Description fields.

requirements.summary: Add/adjust frontend validation helpers for the freeform game name and required prompt, and wire them into wizard step gating.
acceptanceCriteria: Game step validation checks the typed game name (not a selected game ID).
Details step validation includes prompt validation in addition to title/version/description.
Validation errors are shown using the same patterns as existing fields (message text in English).

file_operations.description: Add validation helpers for freeform game name and mod prompt (both required, non-empty) with English error messages; keep return shape consistent with existing ValidationResult usage.

Update canProceedFromGame to validate the typed gameName (not a game ID) and update canProceedFromDetails to include prompt validation alongside title/version/description; ensure step gating and displayed error messages follow existing patterns.
Wire the new prompt validation helper into the form’s live validation behavior so prompt errors display consistently with other fields.

requirements.summary: Display the stored game name and prompt as read-only metadata in creator and public mod views wherever mod metadata is shown.
acceptanceCriteria: Public mod page shows the mod’s game name and prompt as read-only metadata (in addition to existing title/version/description/files).
Creator manage page shows the mod’s game name and prompt as read-only metadata (in addition to existing metadata).
All user-facing text remains in English.

file_operations.description: Add read-only metadata sections for the mod’s gameName and prompt (English labels) alongside existing title/version/description/files; ensure prompt is shown in a readable, non-editable format.
Add read-only metadata for the mod’s gameName and prompt within the Mod Information card (English labels), without introducing edit controls for these fields.

requirements.summary: Update the frontend query/mutation layer and frontend backend typings so createMod and ModData include prompt and stored game name and compile cleanly.
acceptanceCriteria: useCreateMod mutation sends the new fields required by the backend createMod method.
TypeScript types used by the frontend include the new ModData fields (prompt and the stored game name field) and the app compiles without type errors.
Existing queries and pages using ModData are updated as needed to account for the added fields.

file_operations.description: Update useCreateMod to accept prompt and gameName and call actor.createMod with the correct argument order from the generated backend typings; remove or refactor game listing/creation hooks/imports that are no longer needed after the wizard change so the file compiles cleanly.
Align generated frontend backend typings with the expected createMod signature and ModData fields (gameName and prompt) used by the updated UI and hooks, ensuring TypeScript compilation succeeds.
